item.title: Elusive leopard that terrorized villagers for over a month captured
item.description:
<![CDATA[Raichur: Residentsof D Rampur village in Raichur taluk can finally breathe a sigh of relief as forest officials have successfully captured the leopard that had kept the entire region on edge for nearly one and a half months. The big cat, a male estimated to be around three years old, had been hiding in the Paramashwara hill forest area and frequently venturing near human settlements, creating an atmosphere of fear and panic.

item.title: ‘She pushed me into river while I posed for photo’: Newly-wed man dramatically rescued from Krishna river in Karnataka; accuses wife of 'attempt to murder'
item.description:
<![CDATA[In Raichur, a man was rescued from the Krishna River after allegedly being pushed by his wife from a bridge during a photo session. Sooraj claimed Neethu pushed him while pretending to take his picture, leading to a dramatic rescue by locals who used ropes to pull him to safety amidst high water levels.
